channel.title: Projects on Abhishek Vaid
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Abhishek Vaid

item.title: Automated Machine Learning Application
item.description: In this project I made an Automated Machine Learning tool. This tool can perform Regression and Classification Machine Learning and give output in a CSV file within a matter of 2 Minutes. Link to Website Link to GitHub Repository Automated Machine Learning Application Video Representation Of my Project

item.title: Project-1: COVID-19 data building and visualization
item.description: CORONAVIRUS HAS CLAIMED PRECIOUS LIVES THOUGHOUT THE WORLD. PEOPLE ACROSS THE GLOBE ARE DOING COUNTLESS HOURS OF RESEARCH TO FIND A SOLUTION. MY WORK MEASURES THE AMOUNT OF WORKS DONE BY TITLES PUBLISHED IN JOURNALS ACROSS THE GLOBE AND COMPARES EACH JOURNAL WITH THE AMOUNTS OF TITLES PASSAGES THEY HAVE PRODUCED ON THE CORONA VIRUS WHICH MIGHT BE CLEAR MEASURE OF THERE PARTICIPATION IN CREATING AWARENESS AND SAVING LIVES IN THE PANDEMIC SITUATION.

item.title: Complete Data Visualization Project
item.description: In this project I covered complete Data Visualization using Matplotlib, Seaborn, ggplot2 and Plotly. Its covers all basic to advance including Animated Visualizations. The objective behind making this project was to educate the Data Science Community. The complete project is made using Python Language. Link to Kaggle Notebook Link to GitHub Repository 3D Visualizations

item.title: Project 2: ARIMA and SARIMA Forecasting
item.description: In this project I have taken a Champaign sales dataset and forecasted its upcoming sales trend. To do so I have first checked whether my data is stationery by performing Dickey Fuller test and used the obtained p-value to determine so. After that I have performed Data seasonal differencing to make my data stationery. Then I have plotted my data using statsmodel’s tsaplot for visualizing Autocorrelation(ACF) and Partial Autocorrelation(PACF) to determine values of auto regressive lags(P) and the value of moving average(Q).

item.title: Project 3: House Pricing Regression
item.description: In this project I took house pricing regression train and test datasets. First I did feature engineering on these datasets using heatmaps to visualize null values and replace them with their column mean if numeric and mode if character data. Then I did data encoding by using dummy variables and categorical onehot encoding on my character columns to get numeric values for making ML model. Then I build my model using XGBOOST regressor and did Hyperparameter optimization on my model using RandomSearchCV.

item.title: Project 4: Titanic: Machine Learning from Disaster
item.description: In this project I took Titanic: Machine Learning from Disaster train and test datasets. First I did feature engineering on these datasets using heatmaps to visualize null values and replace them with their column mean if numeric and mode if character data. Then I did data encoding by using dummy variables and categorical onehot encoding on my character columns to get numeric values for making ML model. Then I build my model using SVM classifier.

item.title: Project 5: Digit Recognizer
item.description: In this project I took Kaggle Digit Recognizer MNIST train and test datasets. I used a 6 layer convolutional 2d network to train a Digit image recognition model. I used a relu and softmax activation functions and for loss I used categorical crossentropy. Link to GitHub Repository Link to my Kaggle Notebook Visual Representation of digit image processing by convolutional neural networks Visual Representation of digit image breakdown by convolutional neural networks

item.title: Project 6: Dog-or-Cat-image-recognition-ANN-project
item.description: In this project I took Kaggle Dog-or-Cat-image-recognition train and test datasets. I used a 6 layer convolutional 2d network to train a Digit image recognition model. I used a relu and softmax activation functions and for loss I used categorical crossentropy. Link to GitHub Repository Link to my Kaggle Notebook Visual Representation of cat dog image recognition by convolutional neural networks Visual Representation of epochs run
